question: Does PDPN-mediated activation of CLEC-2 in dendritic cells reorganize the actin cytoskeleton to enhance motility along stromal surfaces? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Thus, activation of CLEC-2 by PDPN rearranges the actin cytoskeleton in DCs to promote efficient motility along stromal surfaces.
content.source_2: In human monocyte-derived dendritic cells, ligation of CLEC-2 by podoplanin failed to elicit F-actin remodeling; instead, sustained RhoAâ€“ROCK activity with elevated myosin light-chain phosphorylation stabilized cortical actomyosin, reduced protrusive structures, and diminished migration on fibroblastic reticular cell layers.
content.source_3: CLEC-2 activation triggered cell spreading via downregulation of RhoA activity and myosin light-chain phosphorylation and triggered F-actin-rich protrusions via Vav signaling and Rac1 activation.
content.source_4: Two-photon imaging of murine lymph nodes showed that CLEC-2 deficiency did not alter dendritic cell actin organization or motility metrics, and PDPN engagement failed to enhance guidance or speed along stromal networks.
